title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:31 <abusenius> has quit  
00:42 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
00:42 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
02:12 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
03:09 <lucaa> has quit  
04:16 <DrLou> has quit  
04:38 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
04:39 <venkatesh> has quit  
04:39 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
05:01 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
05:13 <DrLou> has quit  
05:28 <sburjan`> has quit  
05:28 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
06:20 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
06:34 <sburjan`> has quit  
07:01 <Denis> has quit  
07:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:09 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
07:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <asyd> has quit  
08:05 <asyd> has joined #xwiki  
08:14 <pulasthi> cjdelisle : hi i tried to build your new xwiki datastroe implementation in github  
08:15 <pulasthi> cjdelisle : but got the following error http://pastebin.com/bRtvPZcT  
08:15 <pulasthi> i erased the maven repo and tried but no luck  
08:19 <vmassol> has quit  
08:43 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <asyd> has quit  
09:27 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <sburjan`> has quit  
09:42 <@cjdelisle> pulasthi: the problem looks like you did not setup your settings.xml file as per the xwiki build instructions.  
09:42 <pulasthi> ahh i should replace the settings .xml  
09:43 <pulasthi> ok ill do that thanks  
09:43 <pulasthi> :)  
09:43 <@cjdelisle> sure. I wonder if there is a way we could avoid needing that file  
09:43 <pulasthi> hmm :) that would be better  
09:44 <@cjdelisle> it's a problem of needing to know where the repo is in order to get the information that tells us where the repo is.  
09:44 <@cjdelisle> chicken and the egg  
09:45 <pulasthi> :D  
09:50 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: there is: we need to be fully on maven central ;)  
09:51 <+tmortagne> but that will not happen except for commons and rendering which are planned  
09:51 <+tmortagne> and that will not happen for snapshots anyway  
09:52 <@cjdelisle> oh, then just put the repos into commons pom, won't that do it?  
09:54 <+tmortagne> it would technically but that would not really make sense since commons does not really depends on this repo  
09:55 <+tmortagne> and anyway if you are building snapshot it does not fix anything since you depends on a commons snapshot  
09:55 <+tmortagne> right now at least  
09:55 <+tmortagne> so you would not find the commons root pom  
09:55 <@cjdelisle> ahh. hmm  
09:56 <@cjdelisle> I wish there was a way we could hack that even if it was evil because people should be able to clone one repo and build with no effort.  
09:56 <@sdumitriu> There is, put the repos in every pom  
09:56 <+tmortagne> yep  
09:56 <@sdumitriu> But that's bad  
09:57 <@sdumitriu> That's baaaad  
09:57 <+tmortagne> would be a real pain  
09:57 <+tmortagne> one way would be to put the repos in all repository root poms since you have to clone the whole repo with git  
09:58 <+tmortagne> and then in submodules put relative path to parent poms  
09:58 <xipe> has quit  
09:58 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <+tmortagne> but having setting.xml file sounds way easier for us...  
09:58 <@cjdelisle> for \*us\* yes.  
09:58 <@cjdelisle> If we want contrbiuters, no  
09:58 <@sdumitriu> Except that most other users hit this problem  
09:59 <+tmortagne> it's not that hard for people whiling to contribute either  
09:59 <+tmortagne> they will have more complex issues that this one  
10:00 <lucaa> has quit  
10:00 <@cjdelisle> IMO it's one thing that will stop them. They are looking at the code and trying to understand that and all the sudden they have build issues. If they don't know maven then they are likely to give up.  
10:01 <@cjdelisle> They're thinking about a feature they want and they see in the code what needs changing and build problems will derail their whole train of thought.  
10:01 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <+tmortagne> sure but the possible solution are way too painful for us writing the pom files as far as i can see for now  
10:04 <+tmortagne> and i doubt we are the only one having this issue anyway it's probably the same for pretty mush all maven based big projects  
10:04 <@cjdelisle> what's the worst part about adding repos everywhere? They don't ever have to change.  
10:04 <@sdumitriu> They do  
10:04 <+tmortagne> s/mush/much/  
10:04 <@sdumitriu> Rarely  
10:05 <@cjdelisle> rarely enough that sed is not an option?  
10:05 <@cjdelisle> err \*often  
10:05 <@sdumitriu> We could try  
10:05 <@sdumitriu> If vmassol OKs it  
10:06 <@sdumitriu> Wha't happening with the release? jvelociter was supposed to be the release manager  
10:06 <+tmortagne> having relative paths with repo in root pom of each git repository is probably cleaner  
10:07 <+tmortagne> less stuff in pom file and you don't have changes issues like repository changing  
10:07 <+tmortagne> plus it make possible to build without network a submodule  
10:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <+tmortagne> (if you already have all the needed dependencies in you local repo obviously)  
10:08 <redflame> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <redflame> there was a project ajax based form creation on xwiki  
10:08 <jvdrean> has quit  
10:08 <@sdumitriu> Hi redflame  
10:09 <redflame> hi  
10:09 <redflame> can I ask something about that project/  
10:09 <@sdumitriu> Sure  
10:11 <redflame> from the database point of view,there is need of key -value database.there can be tables like form ,questions,response etc.is it correct?  
10:11 <redflame> for that idea  
10:11 <@sdumitriu> Not quite  
10:12 <@sdumitriu> The form uses the XWiki data model behind  
10:12 <@sdumitriu> Which already offers abstract data structures like classes and objects  
10:12 <redflame> but that classes would ultimately build tables in database.  
10:13 <@sdumitriu> So the outcome of the wizard would be an XWiki Class, a sheet for displaying instances, and an index page  
10:13 <@sdumitriu> Yes, but that's not a concern  
10:13 <@sdumitriu> That's handled automatically  
10:13 <@sdumitriu> All you have to do is create the classes  
10:13 <redflame>  If I wants to do in php without using xwiki then?  
10:14 <@sdumitriu> Then yes, you'd have to define your own mappings  
10:15 <redflame> if I say,for each response I would create a different table.can it fast query if I want to fetch saved responses.  
10:15 <evalica> has quit  
10:15 <redflame> or it is a bad idea from database point of view  
10:15 <redflame> because it would create so many tables  
10:17 <redflame> are you getting what I am asking?  
10:17 <arkub> has quit  
10:18 <@sdumitriu> Well, it depends on how you model your database  
10:19 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <xipe> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <@sdumitriu> In XWiki, all data structures are mapped to the same set of tables  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DatabaseSchema  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> xwikidoc->xwikiobjects->xwikiproperties->(xwikistrings, xwikifloats, xwikidates...)  
10:28 <redflame> if you won't have xwiki then how would you proceed?  
10:28 <redflame> means in basic database terms  
10:41 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <+Denis> vmassol: Hi, just get your message from yesterday, nice to see they have agreed  
10:48 <vmassol> yes, but they haven't sent the license yet....  
10:49 <vmassol> :)  
10:49 <+sburjan> hello.  
10:49 <+sburjan> 2011-04-27 11:48:33,685 [main] WARN  tion.ComponentAnnotationLoader  - Component [org.xwiki.annotation.internal.content.SpaceNormalizerContentAlterer] is being overwritten by component [org.xwiki.annotation.internal.content.SpaceNormalizerContentAlterer] for Role/Hint [role = [org.xwiki.annotation.content.ContentAlterer] hint = [space-normalizer]]. It will not be possible to look it up.  
10:49 <+sburjan> I get this when starting latest build  
10:49 <@sdumitriu> There are duplicates  
10:49 <@sdumitriu> There are duplicate jars  
10:50 <+Denis> vmassol: just for my curiosity, would you mind to forward me the mails ?  
10:50 <vmassol> ok will do  
10:51 <vmassol> done  
10:51 <+Denis> thanks :)  
10:57 <ihalip> has quit  
10:58 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <florinciu> has quit  
11:00 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <redflame> has quit  
11:07 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
11:19 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
11:19 <@sdumitriu> Hi jvelociter  
11:19 <@sdumitriu> Ready for the release?  
11:19 <@sdumitriu> Or you don't want to be the release manager for M1?  
11:20 <+jvelociter> Hi sdumitriu  
11:20 <+jvelociter> unfortunately I won't be able to do M1, yes:(  
11:20 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I've created some directories locally (through idea) but I don't see them through git. Normally I guess a git status or looking at the staging area with gitx shoudl show them no?  
11:20 <+jvelociter> but if it's OK to have a different RM for one milestone I'm still willing to do the other ones  
11:22 <vmassol> ok so we need to find a new RM  
11:22 <vmassol> at least for M1  
11:22 <vmassol> any volunteer?  
11:22 <@sdumitriu> (silence)  
11:22 <vmassol> tic…tac…tic…tac (sounds of the clock counting the seconds)  
11:24 <@sdumitriu> I propose vmassol, our fearless leader!  
11:24 <@cjdelisle> I will but I'll need some guidance.  
11:25 <vmassol> I'm detecting some sarcasm in sdumitriu's message....  
11:26 <vmassol> anyone can help me with git?  
11:26 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: No sarcasm  
11:26 <@sdumitriu> I'm just in a funny mood today  
11:27 <vmassol> sdumitriu: can you help me with some very basic git?  
11:27 <@sdumitriu> Sure  
11:27 <vmassol> I just want git to show me what's local and not committed but git status doesn't show it  
11:27 <@sdumitriu> I think the important setting is to force a push to origin during the release  
11:28 <vmassol> vmassol@vincent-massols-macbook-pro ~/dev/xwiki/git/xwiki-platform/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-classloader (master) $ ls -l  
11:28 <vmassol> total 24  
11:28 <vmassol> -rw-r--r--  1 vmassol  staff  2633 Apr  8 17:21 pom.xml  
11:28 <vmassol> drwxr-xr-x  4 vmassol  staff   136 Apr  8 17:21 src  
11:28 <vmassol> drwxr-xr-x  8 vmassol  staff   272 Apr 21 16:51 target  
11:28 <vmassol> drwxr-xr-x  3 vmassol  staff   102 Apr 22 17:09 xwiki-platform-classloader-api  
11:28 <vmassol> drwxr-xr-x  4 vmassol  staff   136 Apr 22 17:08 xwiki-platform-classloader-protocols  
11:28 <vmassol> -rw-r--r--  1 vmassol  staff  4173 Apr 22 17:04 xwiki-platform-classloader.iml  
11:28 <@sdumitriu> I think it's true by default, let me check  
11:28 <vmassol> xwiki-platform-classloader-api is a directory that isn't pushed  
11:28 <@sdumitriu> git st  
11:28 <vmassol> but git status or git diff don't show anything  
11:28 <@sdumitriu> git status  
11:28 <vmassol> ivmassol@vincent-massols-macbook-pro ~/dev/xwiki/git/xwiki-platform/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-classloader (master) $ git status  
11:28 <vmassol> # On branch master  
11:28 <vmassol> nothing to commit (working directory clean)  
11:29 <@sdumitriu> git add xwiki-platform-classloader-api  
11:29 <@sdumitriu> Are you sure it's not there already?  
11:29 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yep just checked on hitgub  
11:29 <vmassol> s/hitgub/github/  
11:29 <+tmortagne> vmassol: git does not see empty folders  
11:29 <vmassol> ahhhh  
11:29 <vmassol> thank tmortagne  
11:30 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Sure, you can do that  
11:30 <+tmortagne> not even sure it sees emty files  
11:30 <@sdumitriu> Yes, it sees empty files  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> But not empty folders  
11:31 <+tmortagne> ok  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> Git tracks files  
11:31 <+tmortagne> I was kind of thinking that it tracks file content actually and not exactly files themself  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> Yes, that's more true  
11:32 <@sdumitriu> It doesn't care much in which folder a file is  
11:32 <@sdumitriu> That's why it tracks moves without explicit git mv  
11:32 <@sdumitriu> (although git mv helps a bit)  
11:33 <@sdumitriu> A lot of commands have --find-copies-harder  
11:47 <pulasthi1> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <pulasthi> has quit  
11:57 <@sdumitriu> So, who's doing the release? cjdelisle?  
11:57 <@sdumitriu> A fresh new process for a fresh new manager?  
11:58 <+sburjan> :)  
12:01 <pulasthi1> has left #xwiki  
12:05 <@cjdelisle> I will if nobody stops me.  
12:06 <@sdumitriu> K, when do you want to start?  
12:06 <@sdumitriu> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleaseProcess  
12:06 <@cjdelisle> now is fine.  
12:06 <@sdumitriu> Give me your SSH public key  
12:06 <@sdumitriu> (in private)  
12:07 <@cjdelisle> I think I posted it to my wiki page so it's not that private anymore  
12:18 <@cjdelisle> Now I understand I am to make a wiki page which illustrated the release plan. Does anyone know where the last one was so I can use it as a guide?  
12:19 <@sdumitriu> It's always the same page  
12:19 <@sdumitriu> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleasePlans  
12:19 <@sdumitriu> It will be simpler since we release top level repos now  
12:19 <@cjdelisle> I see.  
12:19 <@sdumitriu> So it will be just: xwiki-commons, xwiki-rendering, xwiki-platform, xwiki-enterprise  
12:20 <@cjdelisle> ahh yes, very nice  
12:45 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: What's the status? Reading?  
12:45 <@cjdelisle> running enterprise-tests to see what I'll have to fix and running dependency:tree locally.  
12:46 <@sdumitriu> Hm, we have to check what's the status on tests  
12:47 <@sdumitriu> The previous build failed  
12:48 <@cjdelisle> yea, dependency issue so I figured I should make it happen twice before trying to fix anything  
13:02 <@cjdelisle> cat ./releaseplan.txt  
13:03 <@cjdelisle> org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform:pom:3.1-SNAPSHOT  
13:03 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
13:03 <@sdumitriu> :D  
13:03 <@sdumitriu> Ignore that script  
13:03 <@sdumitriu> I never used it  
13:05 <+tmortagne> yep it's useless anyway especially now that we release everything all the time  
13:07 <@cjdelisle> enterprise-tests seems to be workign this time  
13:07 <@sdumitriu> But there's something wrong in the build  
13:09 <@sdumitriu> I think , checking now  
13:09 <@sdumitriu> No, seems OK  
13:10 <@cjdelisle> with dependencies it could be anything, a repo has gone to sleep for a few hours etc etc  
13:19 <@sdumitriu> Found the problem with the dependencies  
13:24 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Why did you remove <scope>provided</scope> for the oldcore dependency on old plugins?  
13:24 <@sdumitriu> This pulls two copies of the jars in the build  
13:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I removed it because it's now aligned with the platform so the shouldn't be a dep on an older version of the platform  
13:25 <@cjdelisle> so I can just do commons, rendering, platform, enterprise, manager and I don't have to bother with commons-core, platform-tools, platform-core etc?  
13:25 <vmassol> maybe there's a remaining version on an old core that hasn't been removed somewhere?  
13:27 <@sdumitriu> The problem is in enterprise-web  
13:28 <@sdumitriu> It depends on platform-web, which due to its packaging doesn't pull in xwiki-oldcore as a dependency  
13:28 <@sdumitriu> And enterprise-web also depends on xwiki-platform-watchlist-api, which pulls in xwiki-oldcore  
13:29 <@sdumitriu> So two jars end up in the build  
13:29 <@sdumitriu> One numbered, one with -SNAPSHOT  
13:29 <@sdumitriu> s/numbered/timestamped  
13:30 <@sdumitriu> The "provided" scope was there not because they were released separately, but exactly to prevent this problem when building enterprise  
13:30 <@sdumitriu> Hm, not quite true  
13:30 <@sdumitriu> Both reasons  
13:31 <@sdumitriu> The "provided" scope was there not just because they were released separately, but also to prevent this problem when building enterprise  
13:31 <@sdumitriu> Actually the first problem is caused by the second one, again because platform-web doesn't remember its dependencies  
13:32 <@sdumitriu> Can you reintroduce the scope in plugins, please?  
13:41 <vmassol> I can look at this later today but not now (busy on something else)  
13:41 <@sdumitriu> It won't affect the release since the same version will be used (3.1-milestone-1), so it's not critical  
14:10 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <@cjdelisle> jvdrean: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/568/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui/CreatePageTest/testCreatePageFromTemplate/  
14:14 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:20 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <florinciu> has quit  
14:25 <+tmortagne> looking at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/568/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.watchlist/WatchlistTest/testAutomaticWatchNewPage/ looks like for some reason automatic watch does not work anymore  
14:27 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <@cjdelisle> bbiab coffee  
14:27 <vmassol> tmortagne: in xwiki-platform-extension-handler-jar you depend on xwiki-platform-classloader  
14:27 <vmassol> I've now split xwiki-platform-classloader locally on my machine into several modules  
14:28 <vmassol> there are now 3 artifacts: -api -protocol-attachmentjar and -protocol-jar  
14:28 <vmassol> which ones do you need for xwiki-platform-extension-handler-jar ?  
14:29 <+tmortagne> vmassol: EM does not need the attachment and stuff like that, only the dynamic classloader itself with standard filesystem URLs  
14:29 <+tmortagne> so probably only the -api one  
14:30 <vmassol> hmmm I think it'll need -protocol-api but only at runtime  
14:30 <vmassol> because otherwise it won't support "jar" urls  
14:30 <+tmortagne> it does not have jar URLs  
14:30 <vmassol> s/-protocol-api/protocoll-jar  
14:30 <+tmortagne> only file URLs  
14:30 <+tmortagne> which is supported in standard  
14:31 <vmassol> ok  
14:31 <+tmortagne> said another way it only load jars coming from its filesystem based local repository  
14:32 <vmassol> for -macro-script module I think we should add runtime deps on protocols, wdyt?  
14:32 <vmassol>     <dependency>  
14:32 <vmassol>       <groupId>org.xwiki.platform</groupId>  
14:32 <vmassol>       <artifactId>xwiki-platform-classloader-api</artifactId>  
14:32 <vmassol>       <version>${project.version}</version>  
14:32 <vmassol>     </dependency>  
14:32 <vmassol>     <dependency>  
14:32 <vmassol>       <groupId>org.xwiki.platform</groupId>  
14:32 <vmassol>       <artifactId>xwiki-platform-classloader-protocol-jar</artifactId>  
14:32 <vmassol>       <version>${project.version}</version>  
14:32 <vmassol>       <scope>runtime</scope>  
14:32 <vmassol>     </dependency>  
14:32 <vmassol>     <dependency>  
14:32 <vmassol>       <groupId>org.xwiki.platform</groupId>  
14:32 <vmassol>       <artifactId>xwiki-platform-classloader-protocol-attachmentjar</artifactId>  
14:33 <+tmortagne> not sure, it does not really depends on it, or maybe just the jar one  
14:33 <vmassol> yes I'm not sure either  
14:34 <+tmortagne> it just mean if you don't have it you will not support attachments but that's ok  
14:34 <vmassol> if we don't list the attachment jar dep here, we'll need to add it in platform-web  
14:34 <+tmortagne> and not depends on it allow us to move script macro to commons  
14:34 <vmassol> yes and that's my goal actually :)  
14:34 <vmassol> good point  
14:39 <vmassol> ok done, hmm should I wait for 3.1M1 to be released before pushing? probably I guess....  
14:39 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <@sdumitriu> We can branch for the release  
14:39 <+tmortagne> probably but given the number or failing test you probably have some time  
14:40 <vmassol> so you'd branch before my push sdumitriu?  
14:40 <@sdumitriu> Not me, the RM  
14:40 <vmassol> (yeah "you" was genericà  
14:40 <vmassol> s/à/)/  
14:40 <vmassol> ok pushing then  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> We'll see if the commit is good to go in the M1 or not  
14:41 <vmassol> ok  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> I doubt the release will start soon  
14:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: fixing extension-handler pom…..  
14:42 <vmassol> (was missing dep on bridge)  
14:42 <vmassol> (was drawn by classloader pom before)  
14:43 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok  
14:43 <vmassol> model actually not bridge  
14:45 <sbose78> has joined #xwiki  
14:49 <Chami1> has left #xwiki  
14:49 <sbose78> Could somebody please process my new wiki request?  
14:49 <vmassol> sbose78: I'll do it in a few minutes

16:10 <@sdumitriu> Hm, might be that you issued the commands in the wrong order:  
16:10 <@sdumitriu> merge branch, then pull, then push  
16:10 <@sdumitriu> Since that way it did a rebase and lost track of the merge commit  
16:11 <@sdumitriu> But that shouldn't happen anyway  
16:11 <@sdumitriu> Confusing  
16:12 <@sdumitriu> The best order would have been:  
16:12 <@sdumitriu> pull, merge, push

16:14 <+tmortagne> - merge feature -> branch  
16:14 <+tmortagne> - pull  
16:14 <+tmortagne> - push

22:14 <mar3lis> hey  
22:14 <mar3lis> earlier i asked how to programicly set values to properties  
22:14 <mar3lis> to objects  
22:14 <mar3lis> but i can't figure it out..  
22:14 <@sdumitriu> Hi mar3lis  
22:15 <mar3lis> you said with getXObject  
22:15 <@cjdelisle> There's a good set of links in the scripting guide  
22:15 <@sdumitriu> There was the snippet with setting rights, let me find it  
22:15 <@sdumitriu> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Setting%20Rights  
22:16 <@sdumitriu> The essense is:  
22:16 <@sdumitriu> #set ($mydoc = $xwiki.getDocument("Space.Page"))  
22:16 <@sdumitriu> #set ($rightsObject = $mydoc.getObject("XWiki.XWikiRights", true))  
22:16 <@sdumitriu> #set ($result = $rightsObject.set("levels", "edit"))  
22:16 <@sdumitriu> $mydoc.save()  
22:17 <@sdumitriu> Oh, crap, Groovy is so awesome! http://docs.codehaus.org/display/GROOVY/Groovy+1.8+release+notes  
22:18 <@sdumitriu> Their release notes are a lot richer than ours  
22:19 <@cjdelisle> I wonder if they go into a lock and stablize cycle before each release.  
22:19 <@cjdelisle> well... we do, it begins on release day and it ends on the day it's released.  
22:19 <@sdumitriu> We can ask them, they're good friends with XWiki  
22:20 <@cjdelisle> lots of "cannot repeat" test failures here are quite repeatable if you run all the tests.  
22:21 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Don't know if you're following pattent suits, but this is a good read: http://www.groklaw.net/article.php?story=20110427052238659  
22:22 <@cjdelisle> hmm b&n strikes back  
22:23 <@cjdelisle> It's obvious to me where this is heading, we are heading toward a "need to know" internet.  
22:23 <@sdumitriu> They expose the sham behind the discussions, since they refused to sign the NDA  
22:23 <@cjdelisle> If you don't have a provable legitiment need to know who runs website X or who is selling product Y then you won't know.  
22:24 <@cjdelisle> Information is basicly free at the moment, so much (personal) information runs free because it is rairly used against people. This patent/copyright/etc [frivolous] litigation is changing that.  
22:26 <@sdumitriu> I wonder what would happen if the whole OIN (+friends) were to suit MS for all the patents they infringe  
22:27 <@sdumitriu> Total patent nuke  
22:27 <@cjdelisle> I think it would be funny if the isps got mad and decided to put it in the tos that you can't sue people.  
22:27 <@sdumitriu> Probably the lawsuits would run a decade  
22:28 <+sburjan`> what is OIN ?  
22:29 <@sdumitriu> Open Invention Network, a patent pool from many companies that agree never to sue each other and to defend each other, when it comes to Linux  
22:29 <+sburjan`> very cool idea  
22:29 <+sburjan`> never heard of this  
22:29 <@sdumitriu> Really? There are regular news about big (and small) companies that join OIN  
22:30 <@cjdelisle> did you hear about the new SCO company going after google?

22:58 <@cjdelisle> You would do #set($myList =  $doc.getXObject('My.Class').getProperty('aList').getValue())
